verses.roman:
śuna bhāi ei śloka karaha vicāra
eka mukhya-tattva, tina tāhāra pracāra

synonyms: śuna—please listen; bhāi—brothers; ei—this; śloka—verse; karaha—please give; vicāra—consideration; eka—one; mukhya—principal; tattva—truth; tina—three; tāhāra—of that; pracāra—manifestations.
translation: My dear brothers, kindly listen to the explanation of this verse and consider its meaning: the one original entity is known in His three different features.
